definition: dare not go one step beyond the prescribed limit
pinyin: bu4 gan3 yue4 Lei2 chi2 yi1 bu4

definition: (negative prefix)/not/no
to dare/daring/(polite) may I venture
generic word for peoples or states of south China or south Asia at different historical periods/abbr. for Vietnam 越南
to exceed/to climb over/to surpass/the more... the more
surname Lei
thunder/mine (weapon)/(Internet slang) terrifying/terrific
pond/reservoir/moat
surname Chi
one/1/single/a (article)/as soon as/entire/whole/all/throughout/"one" radical in Chinese characters (Kangxi radical 1)/also pr. [yao1] for greater clarity when spelling out numbers digit by digit
surname Bu
a step/a pace/walk/march/stages in a process/situation

sentences.english: Why do we have to stick to conventions and dare not go one step beyond the prescribed limit?
sentences.chinese: 我们为什么要墨守成规，不敢越雷池一步呢？

definition: to follow the compass and go with the set square (idiom); to follow the rules inflexibly/to act according to convention
not overstepping the prescribed limits/to remain within bounds
faulted at every turn (idiom); can't get anything right
to stand still without advancing (idiom); to hesitate and hold back
to adhere strictly (to the rules)
to act as one thinks fit/to have one's own way
to follow the compass and go with the set square (idiom); to follow the rules inflexibly/to act according to convention
hidebound by convention (idiom)
afraid of the head, terrified of the tail (idiom); ever fearful and nervous/afraid of the slightest thing
(idiom) to continue in the same old rut/diehard conservative attitudes
to shrink back in fear (idiom); too cowardly to advance
doctrine/dogma/creed/dogmatic
lit. not aiming to achieve the best possible result, but rather trying to avoid making mistakes (idiom)/fig. to take a risk-averse approach
pinyin: bu4 qiu2 you3 gong1 , dan4 qiu2 wu2 guo4

definition: wary
lit. as if walking on thin ice (idiom)/fig. to be extremely cautious/to be skating on thin ice
trembling with fear/with fear and trepidation
